10.title: Wonderful
10.review: A wonderful piece of green space close to Camden/London. You can spend all day here as the paths criss cross and there is lots to see.

11.title: Within the city but not
11.review: A place generations have gone to walk, run, picnic and play. The locus of many stories. Lovely architecture and a location in which you can completely forget, momentarily, that you are in one of the wordl's busiest cities. I have always found it worth the visit.

12.title: It's all up hill????
12.review: We took the  24 bus from Leicester Square to Hampstead and walked through a portion of the Heath.  It is a lovely park if you  live nearby, but I would not recommend it as a destination from London.  Funnily, it was one of those places that every where we went was up hill???

13.title: Park day
13.review: Beautiful day out around green aria in London , around is a small zoo with few birds and animals and lots of flowers :red_heart::tulip::tulip:

14.title: Amazing hiking trails- easy to get disoriented
14.review: My husband led the way, picking out a hike while I worked. I liked the gorgeous homes that must have cost a small country's GNP but the whole area is worth exploring- great views of course of all of London.

15.title: Great walking
15.review: A delightful area for a countryside walk. The paths and trees make it seem as though the city is far away. Signposting is not good - and some paths are muddy. It helps to have a map - or to know where you are going.

16.title: Views for miles
16.review: Great view over the whole of London on top of Parliament Hill. Great are for dog walkers and runners.

17.title: Top Neighbourhood
17.review: Nice, quite, beautiful houses and parks London views from Parliament Hill are amazing Very familiar and high standing houses

18.title: Wonderful open natural space in London
18.review: A really natural environment for all to enjoy and with all manner of nature to discover.  Really good walks and views in an unspoiled environment.

19.title: My favorite place on Earth
19.review: There are so many gorgeous parks in and around London, but none hold a candle to the Heath. I've been here many, many times and I do not exaggerate when I say I can spend hours here. So much to explore, so many beautiful viewpoints. If you want to remove yourself from the bustle of the city and escape for a while, this is the place to do it.
